will be back on Curb Your Enthusiasm when the Larry David Letterman comedy starts its eighth season on HBO in June. Here's a funny story about Lewis and David Letterman from nearly 40 years ago. After I made my first appearance on the Johnny Carson show in, like, 1974, Larry and I went shopping in Macy's. He kept following me about five steps behind, humming the Tonight Show theme really loud and pointing at me. Naturally, we got thrown out of Macy's for him doing that. It was nice of him. takes on lingering controversies from the war effort and often assigns blame elsewhere. The looting of an Iraqi museum, which became a worldwide symbol of a lack of order? The media reports were way overblown, and the news stories tended not to blame the Iraqi fighters for breaking into the museum, turning it into a combat zone, and putting its collections at risk.
